name: Bally's Atlantic City

reviews.text: I got to check in at 2:45 pm and was alerted that it would be an extra $10 fee for showing up before 3pm. Myself along with 20 other patrons decided to wait in line for the extra 15 mins to not have to pay this new "fee". What a joke ...
reviews.title: Steals $10

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just like everyone else, I read lots of reviews and was concerned about the room. I had no need to worry. There were only 2 people ahead of me in line to check-in so I waited 5 minutes which was not a problem. The front desk person was extremely friendly and helpful. My room was in the Tower and as a comp room, I didn't expect much. The room was clean and comfortable. I immediately checked for bedbugs and found NOTHING. The bathroom was actually a pleasant surprise. Full marble floor, all in great shape. Bath and shower combination. Housekeeping was fine. There were plenty of towels and bath accessories. Try the Noodle House if you're hungry even up until midnight. The food is cooked right in front of you with decent portion size and excellent flavor. Since there is a walkway that connects Bally's to Caesars and then to the Pier Shops, there's not even a need to go outside for any restaurant or shopping.
reviews.title: Fun weekend at Bally's

reviews.text: I had read the past reviews, and was a little worry, since I was taking my parents and sister for a mini vacation, first time in Atlantic City. But, we had a great time. Our rooms were adjacent to each other, which was great. The rooms were cleaned and the beds were very comfortable. No problem with housekeeping, or check in agents. Everyone treated us very well. The Spa was wonderful, even though extra charge was made to use the facilities. Our rooms were on the ground floor next near the casino, but we heard no noise, and it was very quite. We saw the Legends show, in which Bally's check in agents gave us a $10.00 discount coupon to use. The show was fantastic. The only complain would be outside the hotel. On the boardwalk, a few homeless people walking around, and also on the main streets when you walk towards the other hotels for site seeing. I suggest more security is needed. We will be back and stay at Bally's again.
reviews.title: GREAT EXPERIENCE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I read some of these reviews regarding roaches in Ballys, I have stayed there several times in the Towers and never had an issue with anything, Those complaining about roaches, most likely brought them there.
reviews.title: BALLYS GREAT PLACE TO STAY

reviews.text: The casino is a decent size, I had some luck there, hit and miss like all casinos, the great thing is it connects to another casino and there are rows of casinos to visit if you want variety, Thumbs up for Ballys, see you This Weekend. December 21 - 23. 2012
reviews.title: A beautiful hotel spa that has fallen from greatness

reviews.text: I spent one nihgt before the Xmas holiday at the Ballys Hotel and Casino in AC. It was a trip of six guys to gamble and watch football before the holiday family time kicked in. I normally stay at Borgata, but chose this property to be in the same area as the other guys who were split between Ballys and Ceasar's. I travel to AC at least 4x-6x a year.
reviews.title: Guys Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I arrived on a Sunday afternoon and found a fairly bustling lobby. The check in line was a bit daunting but once I got into the line, I found that it moved fairly quickly. While in the line, a front desk manager came out to announce that the hotel was waiving its "early check-in fee" for that afternoon as we were all in line before 4PM. ( It was about 2:45pm) This was a complete turn-off to the hotel and something I had never heard of before. I nver heard what the fee amount was to have been, but thought it a gratuitous gauge of customers. The announcement was made as if they were doing people a great favor and was really obnoxious.
reviews.title: Run Away from Bally's AC

reviews.text: Beyond that, I had a nice sized room in the Tower Building. it faced the ocean and was very comfortable, though I spent less than six hours in it over the 18 hours I was there. My only complaint would be that the walls/floors seem a bit thin as I could hear footsteps and movements from other rooms when i went to bed. We also had dinner in the restaurant on the lower level. The clams and drinks were a big hit with our little group. I also thought the front desk staff and casino staff were friendly and well trained.
reviews.title: Too much casino

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would return with my wife just because she would like the size of the room and the proximity to Ceasar's Pier shops. But I guess we would arrive late to avoid any fees for being early.
reviews.title: Nice, decent place in the middle of the other casinos
Bally's or Claridge?
reviews.text: This place is horrible! We arrived on 12/23/12 as I booked a ruby room which is in the claridege tower for our Christmas getaway. What a big mistake this was. We were given non-smoking room 934 and as soon as I stepped on that elevator I knew this would not be good. The halls are dark and dank with a musty smell. I opened the door to 934 and the first thing I noticed was a faint odor of cigarette smoke. The room was like being in a smoking port-a-potty!! I immediately went back down to the hotel check-in desk and politely explained the condition of the room and was "upgraded" (her words) to the tower room 2238. By the way total check in time was 4 hours - UGH. I opened the door and was pleasantly surprised. I walked in the bathroom - which by the way looks absolutely beautiful but on further inspection noticed the shower stall had a thick coat of shower scum and the shower head was filled with what looked like mold and some kind of black gunk - YUCK. I would never ever ever return to this dump!!!

This was my first time at Bally’s Atlantic City, and it will surely be my last. I have one word for the room we were given, GROSS. We were given a room in the Claridge tower, which is a hike from the main lobby area to the battered elevators which take you up to the rooms. The shabby condition of the elevators and the disgustingly stained hallway carpet should have been a clue as to what we would find when we entered our room. I can honestly say that nothing in our room was clean. The room carpet was filthy and had remnants of trash, crumbs, open safety pins and hair ALL over the place (see photo). Did I mention hair? Yes, there was hair everywhere in this room, long hair, curly hair, short hair, hair in the bathroom sink, hair on the vanity, hair in the tub, hair on the toilet, hair on the bathroom floor, clumps of hair on the carpet. I've never seen anything like it. I don’t think the room had been vacuumed or dusted in a very, very long time. I could write my name with my finger in the layer of dust on the bedside lamp. The closet’s mirror doors had fingerprints and smudges all over it. The carpet in the closet had about a 1/2 inch of dust throughout. There were very noticeable thick cobwebs all over the top of the windows; I find it hard to believe that housekeeping didn't notice this. Ever hear of a feather duster or vacuum, Bally’s?
reviews.title: Filthy, Disgusting and Trashy

reviews.text: The beds: There were numerous cigarette burn holes in both coverlet blankets on the beds, as well as a very big burn hole on one of the comforters under the top sheet. These should have been thrown out but apparently Bally’s thinks it’s OK to continue to use these and that their patrons will be pleased with a plethora of stains and burn holes. The beds have fabric covered box springs and one of them was so torn and stained that it warranted a photo. How does inferior, worn, torn, stained and burned bedding go unnoticed by housekeeping? The furniture was battered and worn and dusty, and the beds were small and beyond uncomfortable.
reviews.title: Great Room!

reviews.text: The bathroom was tiny with peeling wallpaper and dirty wall tiles in the shower. The floor was utterly gross and looked like it hadn’t been washed in months, there wasn’t one clean spot on this floor. There were also pieces of what appeared to be either cereal or cat food on the floor of the bathroom. The floor is light in color, so the filth, hair and food on the floor was immediately noticeable upon opening the half sized door. The bathroom light switch was so dirty and grimy that I can’t even describe it so see for yourself in the photos attached to this review. The air vent in the bathroom was covered in filth and dust, so much so that it really makes you wonder what you’re breathing in when in this room. The shower curtain smelled funky and had so many brown stains on it, I wondered when and if it was ever washed. The stiff plastic curtain behind it was equally gross. I’ve been in public restrooms that were cleaner than this bathroom.
reviews.title: Ballys tower was safe!!

reviews.text: The AC/heating unit above the window was peeling in several places and vents also covered in dust. What I don’t understand is how Bally’s could let things get this bad. It is quite obvious that housekeeping just goes into rooms to change sheets, replenish tissue and cups and does nothing more. This was not a cheap room at $250/night, and even if it were, it would still be unacceptable. I’ve stayed at Hampton Inn’s and Holiday Inn Express hotels and found them to be far superior to Bally’s in every way, at half the price. I think management needs to seriously consider checking up on their housekeeping staff because they are obviously not doing their job, but given the fact that the room was so filthy, it’s obvious that they just don’t care about quality or cleanliness. I have never been so grossed out in a hotel before, I wanted to leave minutes after entering the room. Sleeping in the car in 30 degree weather would have been better than staying in this room. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone, ever.
reviews.title: Never again

reviews.text: Two day trip to celebrate my buddy's birthday. I was upgraded to a luxury room in the Bally's Tower. Room had great room and was recently renovated. Room was spacious and modern. I like staying near Bally's as it is a central location to other attractions (shopping, etc.) and casinos.
reviews.title: If you have kids, don't waste your money staying here.

reviews.text: I've been to Atlantic City many times and knew what to expect when I made a reservation at Bally's. I used HotelTonight which had a rate of $44 after taxes. For any reservation, unless you specifically book a Dennis, or Tower room, you will receive a room in the Claridge Tower. The Claridge was a former hotel/casino that Bally's bought back in 2002 and is used for its hotel rooms only.
reviews.title: The Claridge Tower
Early check in fee.
reviews.text: The Claridge Tower hotel rooms are basically good for a nights sleep and a shower. The TV is a old tube TV, my window view was inland of the roof (other rooms may have a ocean view), the room itself was small and dirty, and the bathroom is tiny. I had low expectations, and they were met. The only issue was a small bug in the tub, that was easily washed down the drain. The walls are thin, and I heard plenty of noise in the hall and rooms next door.
Tip: Check-in is at 4pm and they will try to charge you $10 or so if you want to check in early. At 4pm there was a line to check-in that took forever as there were only 2 people staffing the desk.
reviews.title: Very nice room

reviews.text: The Claridge Towers are functional, and worth it for under $50. If you want something a bit nicer in AC, there are several options, with the Dennis and Tower rooms being newer and much nicer. The location of Bally's is convenient, and the 24 hour bar in the Wild Wild West has cheap rounds, which makes for a great nightcap. Overall, I came in with low expectations and got what I expected.
reviews.title: The Worse Experience Ever-Roach Pad

reviews.text: Currently waiting in line. We have already waited over 25 min to check in. The poor lady about ten in front of us is getting charged 10 extra dollars for checking in before 3 pm. It is 258 pm. Unbelievable. This is service? The service agent responds to the customers concern with " i dont make the rules i follow them." Upper management, what are you thinking? To all others be ware. If they care about 2 minutes and 10 dollars think about all the other corners they are cutting. Im done with this guy.
reviews.title: Don't stay here

aka: Bally`s Atlantic City And Claridge Tower Hotel
